intro: Aquilegia caerulea, commonly known as the Colorado blue columbine, is a flowering plant native to the Rocky Mountains of North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are usually erect and branched. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often growing in alpine or rocky habitats. Aquilegia caerulea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
